intro: Jacobaea rubella, commonly known as the red ragged robin, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in wet meadows and marshy areas, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Its striking red and pink flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Jacobaea rubella is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered a rare species in some regions.
